title: On-hover hyperlink target text obscures prompt
body:
When I hover over a hyperlink, alacritty displays the link target at the bottom of the screen. This obscures the prompt and in particular I have the following problem: - Background: I switch between other MacOS apps and full-screen Alacritty using a single key (configured in hammerspoon) - Sometimes, when I switch back to Alacritty, I expect to be able to start typing immediately at a prompt, but the hyperlink target on-hover text is obscuring the prompt. To be clear, this is the hyperlink target on-hover text I'm referring to: ☝️ my prompt is underneath that black bar. The lines above are from `git log`. I couldn't see options to configure this behavior. [Thanks very much for Alacritty; I've recently switched. Apart from anything else, the plain text configuration file that I can keep under version control is a huge advantage over the graphical configuration tool in the terminal emulator I was previously using, and setting keybindings to send tmux commands was really easy.] ### System OS: MacOS Version: `alacritty 0.11.0-rc1 (7cd180da)` ### Logs
-vv and --print-events output ``` [0.000015630s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Welcome to Alacritty [0.000299252s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Version 0.11.0-rc1 (7cd180da) [0.001184529s] [INFO ] [alacritty]
